alert.note: Alert for Meriwether; Pike; Troup (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 26 at 9:47AM EDT until March 26 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Meriwether County in west central Georgia... Northern Pike County in west central Georgia... Troup County in west central Georgia... * Until 345 PM EDT. * At 947 AM EDT, Radar and automated rain gauges have estimated between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... LaGrange, Greenville, West Point, Hogansville, Pine Mountain, Luthersville, Williamson, Haralson, Lone Oak, Gay, Concord, Odessadale, Saint Marks, Mountville, Stovall, Big Springs, Louise, Rocky Mount, Wooster and Imlac. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
